_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Crude Petroleum and Natural Gas Extraction

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
North Star Energy LLC  Ipswich Bulk Site complies with NFPA-58 Requirements for LP GAS STORAGE, and it is our policy to follow all state and local laws, and to notify the Ipswich fire department to respond if an emergency should occur. A brief description of the facility and the regulated substance handled. This facility is a retail outlet. We sell propane on the farm, to residential, commercial residents and to retail customers. This facility consists of one 21,000 and one 18,000 gallon tank with associated piping, valves, and misc equipment. The facility when filled to capacity can hold up to 31,200 gallons of propane.
The general accidental release prevention program and chemical specific prevention steps: This facility complies with all state and local laws and NFPA-58 STANDARD FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF LIQUID PETROLEUM GASES. And the system is designed, installed, and maintained within state, local and NFPA-58 rules and regulations in mind.
The 5 year accident history. We have never had an accident involving propane that has caused death, injury, evacuation, enviromental damage, or personal injury.
The emergency response program. In the event of an emergency involving North Star Energys Ipswich bulk plant facility the Ipswich fire department shall be notified and requested to respond to the site.
Plan changes to improve safety. Our insurance agents have inspected our facility and modifications have been made to improve safety. Safety improvement are an ongoing process and will continue to be made. There are no specific propane safety recommendations for improvements at this time.
